column3: Testing this change now. Wondering if it would be preferable at some point to codify these steps in a Vagrantfile? That'd be a bit more automated, but still transparent.\n
Some small comments, but in general the changes look good to me!\n

> Testing this change now. Wondering if it would be preferable at some point to codify these steps in a Vagrantfile? That'd be a bit more automated, but still transparent.\n\nThat has been suggested before. But at some point a human has to manually execute some steps, and be able to verify them. Gitian is already supposed to automate the process of building in VMs. Automating the creation of VMs t
Any reason we want to go through the process of editing with `nano` manually instead of just saying something like "Run `sed -i 's/^PermitRootLogin.*/PermitRootLogin yes/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config`"?\n
Perhaps out of scope, but the "Register and download the Apple SDK" bit of the linked instructions is pretty confusing, given that we've said nothing so far about being within an OS X context.\n
The Apple SDK is only required for gitian building the OSX binary, Linux and Windows can be built without it. There's nothing OSX specific about this guide or the release process.\n
